channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: Is Barron Trump’s college decision in flux? Absence of him and his security at orientation raises questions
item.description: Last week, former President Donald Trump revealed that his son, Barron Trump, will attend a university in New York, deviating from the family's Ivy League tradition. While the school remains undisclosed, Trump cited campus unrest as a factor in the decision. Barron's academic excellence and campus involvement have been praised, adding intrigue.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: One cigarette butt and DNA match: How police decoded decades-old murder mystery
item.description: DNA evidence from a cigarette butt has led to the arrest of 65-year-old Kenneth Kundert for the 1980 rape and murder of Boeing instructor Dorothy Silzel in Kent, Washington. New forensic genealogy technology identified Kundert among potential suspects. He was apprehended following a joint effort with Arkansas authorities and will face charges upon extradition to Washington.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Who is Deadpool killer that kills two Florida women for 'sake of killing'
item.description: Tattooed Deadpool Killer Wade Wilson has been sentenced to death by a Florida court for the 2019 murders of Kristine Melton and Diane Ruiz. The court described the crimes as heinous and premeditated. Despite the brutal nature of his actions, Wilson received numerous letters of support and explicit photographs during his imprisonment.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Watch: IDF rescues father of 11 after 326 days, first successful rescue from Gaza’s tunnels
item.description: The Israeli Defense Forces rescued Qaid Farhan Alkadi from Hamas captivity after 326 days. Alkadi, found in a Hamas tunnel, expressed gratitude to IDF troops and urged the rescue of other hostages. He was taken to Soroka Hospital for evaluation and spoke with Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu about the urgency of rescuing others.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Nasa’s Chandra X-ray observatory marks 25 years of unprecedented cosmic discoveries
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US elections: Trump’s economic lead diminishes as GOP aides rally behind Harris, new poll shows
item.description: Vice President Kamala Harris is gaining momentum against former President Donald Trump in the 2024 US presidential race, especially in critical areas like the economy and crime, per recent Reuters/Ipsos polls. Harris's support is growing, bolstered by endorsements from influential former Republican staffers, indicating a significant shift in voter sentiment.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Telegram CEO Pavel Durov’s arrest linked to missing video game streamer Juli Vavilova. Social media trail or honey trap?
item.description: Telegram CEO Pavel Durov was arrested at a Paris airport, coinciding with the mysterious disappearance of 24-year-old streamer Juli Vavilova, who was last seen with him. This unfolding story involves French investigations into serious allegations against Durov, sparking speculation about her role in his capture and their relationship.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘Left in tears’: Meghan Markle struggles with backlash over her lifestyle brand’s debut
item.description: Meghan Markle's American Riviera Orchard, launched in March, is facing hurdles. The brand's inaugural product, strawberry jam, received negative reviews for being overpriced and underwhelming. Despite these challenges, Meghan remains hopeful about her brand's potential and continues to focus on achieving positive reception.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Did Matthew Perry's regrets about his love life contribute to his Ketamine overdose? Here’s what his ex-girlfriend has to say
item.description: Matthew Perry's death in 2021 from a ketamine overdose shocked many. Insights reveal that his emotional struggles were deeply tied to regrets over ending a relationship with Rachel Dunn, whom he considered 'the love of his life.' This loss contributed significantly to his downward spiral into addiction, according to ex-girlfriend Kayti Edwards.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump campaign fires back at 'preposterous' Harris border wall narrative post media report: 'Total bulls**t'
item.description: The Trump campaign dismisses reports suggesting Vice President Kamala Harris has softened her stance on border wall construction. Despite backing a bipartisan border security bill, the campaign insists Harris remains opposed to the wall. Trump senior adviser Jason Miller strongly denies any change in her position, characterizing the allegations as untrue.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US mother handcuffed 6-year-old son, let Pitbull attack him as punishment
item.description: A mother and three others were arrested after a 6-year-old boy in Savannah, Ohio, was seriously injured in a pit bull attack while restrained with handcuffs on his hands and feet as a form of "corporal punishment," according to the Ashland County Sheriff's Office. The boy sustained bites to his neck and ear and was promptly airlifted to the hospital for treatment.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US baking influencer criticized for in-flight bread-making: 'It’s a plane, not a cooking class!'
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Trump staff 'verbally abused and pushed official', claims Arlington National Cemetery
item.description: Two of Donald Trump's campaign staff members allegedly had a 'verbal and physical altercation' with an Arlington National Cemetery official during Trump's visit to honour servicemembers lost in the 2021 Afghanistan withdrawal. Trump’s campaign denies the accusations, citing interference by a visitor. Arlington National Cemetery confirmed the incident and has filed a report.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Yell at me, if ...': Elon Musk responds to Zuckerberg’s regret over Covid-19 censorship
item.description: Elon Musk reiterated the significance of supporting diverse viewpoints on social media after Mark Zuckerberg expressed regret for censoring Covid-19 content under pressure from the Biden administration. This disclosure ignited political debates, with former President Trump using it to bolster his claims regarding the 2020 election.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'Duty to warn': Canadian police alert aide to slain Sikh separatist Nijjar of increased threats
item.description: Canadian police have issued a warning to Inderjeet Singh Gosal, an aide to the assassinated Sikh separatist leader Hardeep Singh Nijjar, due to increased threats. Nijjar’s assassination has spurred controversy, with allegations about potential Indian government involvement. Canada’s police have charged four individuals, while India denies any role. The FBI is investigating other related threats.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Is droplets a source of Mpox transmission? What we know so far
item.description: The World Health Organization emphasizes that mpox is chiefly transmitted through close physical contact, rather than respiratory droplets. The Democratic Republic of Congo faces outbreaks involving Clade 1a and Clade 1b variants. Ongoing studies aim to better understand the transmission and severity of the new Clade 1b.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Japan on high alert as Typhoon Shanshan nears with torrential rain and gusty winds
item.description: Japan is bracing for Typhoon Shanshan, expected to bring severe weather, including heavy rain and strong winds. Airlines like ANA and Japan Airlines have cancelled numerous domestic flights, and some bullet trains are suspended. The storm is expected to hit Kyushu island and possibly reach central and eastern areas, including Tokyo. Authorities advise caution.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Nancy Pelosi’s raw response to January 6 riot: 'Trump got to pay a price’, unreleased footage shows
item.description: Unreleased footage from January 7, 2021, portrays former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi condemning Trump post-Capitol riot. Captured by her daughter and shared with the House Committee, it highlights Pelosi’s immediate outrage and her determination to hold Trump accountable. The footage also reveals Pelosi's frustration over security lapses and chaotic evacuation.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Heat advisory and severe storms hit Michigan's Lansing: Over 16,000 without power, weather warnings in effect
item.description: A heat advisory has been issued in Lansing due to a late-summer heatwave, with temperatures in the low 90s and high humidity making it feel like 105 degrees. Severe storms are expected to bring damaging winds, rain, and hail. Power outages affect over 16,100 customers.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: North Korea test-fires rocket launcher with new 'guiding system'
item.description: North Korea's Kim Jong Un supervised a test-firing of a 240mm multiple rocket launcher equipped with a new guiding system. This activity is part of North Korea's broader initiative to strengthen its military capabilities. The US and South Korea have alleged that Pyongyang has been supplying Russia with missiles. Tensions between the Koreas are at a high point.
